attachments.title: Fourier–Motzkin elimination
attachments.text:
Fourier–Motzkin elimination, also known as the FME method, is a mathematical algorithm for eliminating variables from a system of linear inequalities. It can output real solutions.
The algorithm is named after Joseph Fourier and Theodore Motzkin who independently discovered the method in 1827 and in 1936, respectively.

text: E.g. <https://github.com/ds4dm/Tulip.jl> is a linear programming solver in pure Julia
